author: mmerz
msg: More minor modifications to the blank sample.

author: kentam
msg: Separated the ControlConstraintValidator into two different classes:
- ConstrolConstraintValidator, which is used for run time validation
- ConstrolConstraintAptValidator, which is used for build time validation
This was done because performing validation at build time requires the Mirror API.  If both runtime and build time
validation is performed by the same class, then control clients will require to have the Mirror API in their classpath.
Separating the validator into 2 classes eliminates this requirement.

author: mmerz
